message: What's the best/easiest way to implement search on a Django site?
Yeah, Haystack is a Django API to access stuff like Whoosh or Solr etc
Haystack http://haystacksearch.org/
And it looks like haystack requires something like whoosh?
I'm using ep.io and from a cursory inspection, it looks like backends for search aren't really supported. Does Django itself provide any of this functionality?
Whoosh is a pure Python implementation, not sure why it wouldn't be supported..
According to this thread it's because it writes to disk...https://convore.com/epio/django-hastack-search-backend/
If you absolutely need search on something like ep.io, use the simple backend
Doesn't support any of the advanced functionality (that I know of), but it should be enough for simple tasks
@pewpewarrows I was wondering about that. I think I'll give it a whirl. Thanks.
You could also ask if they will turn on one of the postgres-backed search systems.
@coderanger What are those search systems so I can look into them? Thank you, btw.
The important bit on the ep.io side is to compile the fti.so module
This isn't supported by Hatstack at all, but you could build something at least
@dsr http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.0/static/textsearch.html
I implemented search for http://wanto.com using Haystack + Solr and it works very well
A web hosted search backend might also work for people that can't install whoosh etc. http://websolr.com/  or http://indextank.com/
@eka Is that on ep.io?
you can use haystack with whoosh as backend, it will work on epio according to https://convore.com/epio/django-hastack-search-backend/
@dsr sorry for the late reply. is not on ep.io  is on slicehost
